isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL FILTER HEADER AND THROTTLE LINKAGE ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: FUEL FILTER HEADER AND THROTTLE LINKAGE ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Using an appropriate filter wrench, remove the fuel filters from the header and discard.

Loosen and remove the three mounting bolts which secure the fuel filter header to the crankcase, then remove the header with throttle cable bracket attached. Refer to Figure 11.24
.

note.para: On those units equipped with a bellcrank bracket and control rod throttle linkage, remove ball joint from engine control lever for filter header removal.

figure.caption: Figure 11.22. Remove Upper and Lower Throttle Return Springs.
Figure 11.23. Fuel Return Tube Removal (Early Production w/MW Pump Shown).
Figure 11.24. Remove Filter Header and Bracket.

step1.para:
If the MW fuel injection pump is equipped with an electric shut-off solenoid, remove as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.25
)

step2.para: Disconnect the harness at the solenoid connector.
Remove the bolt and nut at rod end at stop lever control.
Remove solenoid mounting bracket bolts and remove solenoid and bracket as a unit.

step1.para:
If the PES6A fuel injection pump is equipped with an electric shut-off solenoid, remove as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.26
)

note.para: Solenoid is a "Switchless" design and is located on in-board side of Injection Pump.

step2.para: Loosen the jam nut at the female rod end.
Unscrew the swivel from the female rod end.
Disconnect the metri-pack connector from the harness.
Access the injection pump to adapter housing mounting nuts and remove the solenoid and bracket assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 11.25. Solenoid Removal "Internal Switch" (Model MW Injection Pump Shown).
Figure 11.26. Solenoid Assembly (Installed View) (Model PES6A Injection Pump).

step1.para:
Remove the lube oil supply line as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.27
)

step2.para: Loosen and remove the compression nut at the crankcase elbow.
Remove the hex head hollow screw and copper gaskets from the banjo fitting at the fuel injection pump oil inlet.
Remove the tube assembly and discard the sealing sleeve at the compression nut end of the tube.
Cap the pump oil inlet and the elbow at the crankcase.

step1.para: Remove the injection pump drive gear access cover as follows:

step2.para:
Loosen and remove the six fasteners which secure the access cover. Refer to Figure 11.28 or 11.29
.

note.para: Three bolts and nuts secure the access cover to the injection pump adapter housing and three bolts with washers secure the access cover to the housing casting.

figure.caption: Figure 11.27. Remove Lube Oil Supply Line (Model MW Injection Pump Shown).
Figure 11.28. Removal of Current Injection Pump Drive Gear Access Cover Bolts.
Figure 11.29. Removal of Early Injection Pump Drive Gear Access Cover Bolts.

step2.para:
Remove the access cover and gasket from the front cover to expose the injection pump drive gear. Discard the gasket. Refer to Figure 11.30
.

note.para: If equipped, the mechanical tachometer drive adapter may be removed with the access cover.

step1.para:
Remove the injection pump drive gear bolts and hardened washers. Refer to Figure 11.31
.

note.para: The injection pump and adapter assembly can be removed without removing the injection pump drive gear. Drive gear removal is shown at this time for procedural purposes only.

step1.para:
Remove the injection pump drive gear from the pump hub. Refer to Figure 11.32
.

note.para: The polished side of the drive gear faces the hub.

figure.caption: Figure 11.31. Remove Injection Pump Drive Gear Bolts.
Figure 11.32. Remove the Injection Pump Drive Gear.

step1.para:
Remove the injection pump and mounting adapter as an assembly. Discard the gasket. Refer to Figure 11.33
.

note.para: Dowels on the adapter housing hold the pump assembly to the front plate.

IF THE FUEL INJECTION PUMP MOUNTING ADAPTER IS REMOVED FROM THE PUMP TO PERFORM REPAIRS, REINSTALL THE ADAPTER WITH THE FACTORY SET SCRIBE MARKS ALIGNED ONLY AFTER THE PUMP IS FLOW TIMED. IF THE FUEL INJECTION PUMP MOUNTING ADAPTER IS REMOVED FROM THE PUMP AND A NEW ADAPTER IS INSTALLED, THE PUMP MUST BE FLOW TIMED. AFTER FLOW TIMING, STRIKE A NEW MARK ON THE REPLACEMENT MOUNTING ADAPTER TO ALIGN WITH THE SCRIBE MARK LOCATED ON THE INBOARD SIDE OF THE PUMP MOUNTING FLANGE (FIGURE 11.34). REFER TO ROBERT BOSCH FUEL INJECTION PUMP SERVICE MANUAL FORM CGES-375 FOR FLOW TIMING PROCEDURE FOR THE MW INJECTION PUMP OR CGES-480 FOR THE PES6A INJECTION PUMP.

figure.caption: Figure 11.34. Mounting Adapter Installation (Model MW Injection Pump Shown).
